'''Othrondir''' was a [[Men|man]] of [[Gondor]] who lived possibly at or near the [[Emyn Arnen]] during the [[Fourth Age]].

== History ==
Othrondir was an acquaintace of [[Borlas]] of [[Pen-arduin]], to whom he had told about some rumors concerning a certain restlessness in [[Gondor]]. He was also the one who first used the word "canker", evidently referring to secret followers of the "[[Dark Tree]]" that was rising during the year {{FoA|220}}.<ref name="Canker">{{PM|XVI}}, pp. 414, 417.</ref> under the leadership of someone by the name of [[Herumor (The New Shadow)|Herumor]].<ref name="Canker"/>

== Etymology ==
The Sindarin name ''Othrondir'' means "man of an underground stronghold" (''othrond'' 'underground stronghold'<ref>{{WJ|Author}}, p. 414 (Ńote 26), from ''ost'' + ''rond''.</ref> + ''dîr''<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p 354 (entry [[DER]]).</ref> 'man').

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
The name was '''Othrondor''' in the first manuscript (ms. A) of the story, which was then changed to ''Othrondir'' in the following manuscripts (mss. B and C).<ref>{{PM|XVI}}, p. 421, note 16.</ref>
